explanation: The report is not correct. Whether mhd_assert(NULL != hdr) is “dead code” cannot be established from the fragment alone because the semantics of mhd_assert are not given. There are two relevant possibilities: (1) If mhd_assert is a macro that expands to nothing (or is compiled out in release builds) then it is not executed at all, so it is not dead code under Rule 2.2 (note the rule applies to operations that are executed). (2) If mhd_assert is a runtime check that logs/aborts or otherwise has observable behaviour when the condition fails, then removing it could change program behaviour in the (admittedly erroneous) case where the invariant is violated. Even if the programmer believes hdr cannot be NULL, that does not prove the check has no effect in all executions of the project; such defensive assertions can alter behaviour in fault cases and are therefore not provably removable. In short, absent the definition of mhd_assert and the project-wide build configuration, you cannot conclude the assertion is dead code. Hence Agent A’s claim is not justified.
